definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: He grows cabbages on his farm.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的農場種植包心菜。

sentences.english: We put on a cabbage , and now he is in the Legislative Yuan!
sentences.chinese: 我們給他安裝了一顆包心菜，他現在還在立法院呢。

sentences.english: The cabbages were stored in the hole.
Sounds nice. What about vegetable dishes?Or some fish?
sentences.chinese: 清蒸魚不錯，再配上熗炒包心菜就很好了。

sentences.english: The vegetable cabbage is a healthy food.
sentences.chinese: 包心菜是一種健康的食物。

sentences.english: I'd like a hot dog with onion and cabbage.
sentences.chinese: 我要一份熱菜，炒洋蔥跟炒包心菜都要加。

sentences.english: The cabbages were stored in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 包心菜儲藏在地下室裏。

sentences.english: I wonder if two crates of cabbage are enough.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道兩箱包心菜夠不夠？

sentences.english: We need some cabbage for BBQ.
sentences.chinese: 我們的BBQ需要一些包心菜。

definition: variant of 卷心菜[juan3 xin1 cai4]
cabbage (round cabbage most commonly found in Western countries)
